values.name: LeftToRight
values.doc: Language is written left to right.

values.name: RightToLeft
values.doc: Language is written right to left.

values.name: NoAction
values.doc: No Action is taken on profanity

values.name: Deleted
values.doc: Profanity is deleted from the translated text.

values.name: Tag
values.doc: Profanity is marked with the tags.

properties.name: requestId
properties.doc: Value generated by the service to identify the request. It is used for troubleshooting purposes.

properties.name: etag
properties.doc:
Current value of the entity tag for the requested groups of supported languages. 
To make subsequent requests more efficient, the client may send the `ETag` value in an 
`If-None-Match` header field.

properties.name: translation
properties.doc: Languages that support translate API.

valueType.name: TranslationLanguage
valueType.doc:
The value of the translation property is a dictionary of (key, value) pairs. Each key is a BCP 47 language tag.
A key identifies a language for which text can be translated to or translated from.

properties.name: name
properties.doc: Display name of the language in the locale requested via Accept-Language header.

properties.name: nativeName
properties.doc: Display name of the language in the locale native for this language.

properties.name: dir
properties.doc: Directionality, which is rtl for right-to-left languages or ltr for left-to-right languages.

properties.name: transliteration
properties.doc: Languages that support transliteration API.

valueType.name: TransliterationLanguage
valueType.doc:
The value of the transliteration property is a dictionary of (key, value) pairs. 
Each key is a BCP 47 language tag. A key identifies a language for which text can be converted from one script 
to another script.

properties.name: name
properties.doc: Display name of the language in the locale requested via Accept-Language header.

properties.name: nativeName
properties.doc: Display name of the language in the locale native for this language.

properties.name: scripts
properties.doc: List of scripts to convert from.

valueType.name: TransliterableScript
valueType.doc: Script definition with list of script into which given script can be translitered.

properties.name: code
properties.doc: Code identifying the script.

properties.name: name
properties.doc: Display name of the script in the locale requested via Accept-Language header.

properties.name: nativeName
properties.doc: Display name of the language in the locale native for the language.

properties.name: dir
properties.doc: Directionality, which is rtl for right-to-left languages or ltr for left-to-right languages.

properties.name: toScripts
properties.doc: List of scripts available to convert text to.

properties.name: dictionary
properties.doc: Languages that support dictionary API.

valueType.name: SourceDictionaryLanguage
valueType.doc: Properties ot the source dictionary language

properties.name: name
properties.doc: Display name of the language in the locale requested via Accept-Language header.

properties.name: nativeName
properties.doc: Display name of the language in the locale native for this language.

properties.name: dir
properties.doc: Directionality, which is rtl for right-to-left languages or ltr for left-to-right languages.

properties.name: translations
properties.doc: List of languages with alterative translations and examples for the query expressed in the source language.

valueType.name: TargetDictionaryLanguage
valueType.doc: Properties of the target dictionary language

properties.name: name
properties.doc: Display name of the language in the locale requested via Accept-Language header.

properties.name: nativeName
properties.doc: Display name of the language in the locale native for this language.

properties.name: dir
properties.doc: Directionality, which is rtl for right-to-left languages or ltr for left-to-right languages.

properties.name: code
properties.doc: Language code identifying the target language.

models.name: ErrorResponse
models.doc: Representation of the Error Response from Translator Service.

properties.name: requestId
properties.doc: Value generated by the service to identify the request. It is used for troubleshooting purposes.

properties.name: error
properties.doc: Error details.

type.name: ErrorDetails
type.doc: Error details as returned by Translator Service.

properties.name: code
properties.doc: Number identifier of the error.

properties.name: message
properties.doc: Human readable error description.

models.name: TranslateBody
models.doc: Element containing the text for translation.

properties.name: text
properties.doc: Text to translate.

properties.name: script
properties.doc: Specifies the script of the input text.

properties.name: language
properties.doc:
Specifies the language of the input text. Find which languages are available to translate by 
looking up supported languages using the translation scope. If the language parameter isn't 
specified, automatic language detection is applied to determine the source language.

You must use the language parameter rather than autodetection when using the dynamic dictionary feature. 
Note: the dynamic dictionary feature is case-sensitive.

properties.name: textType
properties.doc:
Defines whether the text being translated is plain text or HTML text. Any HTML needs to be a well-formed, 
complete element. Possible values are: plain (default) or html.

properties.name: targets
properties.doc: Translation target parameters.

properties.name: language
properties.doc:
Specifies the language of the output text. The target language must be one of the supported languages included 
in the translation scope. It's possible to translate to multiple languages simultaneously by including 
multiple string values in the targetsLanguage array.

properties.name: script
properties.doc: Specifies the script of the translated text.

properties.name: profanityAction
properties.doc:
Specifies how profanities should be treated in translations.
Possible values are: NoAction (default), Marked or Deleted.

properties.name: profanityMarker
properties.doc:
Specifies how profanities should be marked in translations.
Possible values are: Asterisk (default) or Tag.

properties.name: deploymentName
properties.doc:
Default is ‘general’, which uses NMT system.
‘abc-inc-gpt-4o’, and ‘abc-inc-gpt-4o-mini’ are examples of deployment names which use GPT-4o uses or 
GPT-4o-mini model. ‘gpt-4o’ uses GPT-4o model. 

‘<custom model id>’ uses the custom NMT model tuned by customer.
‘best’ system determines which is the best model to use for the request. This intelligence could be introduced
in future. Customer should have deployed it in their resource.

properties.name: allowFallback
properties.doc:
In the case where a custom system is being used, specifies that the service is allowed to fall back to a
general system when a custom system doesn't exist. 
In the case where a Large Language Model is being used, specifies that the service is allowed to fall
back to a Small Language Model if an error occurs.
Possible values are: true (default) or false.

allowFallback=false specifies that the translation should only use systems trained for the category specified 
by the request. If a translation for language X to language Y requires chaining through a pivot language E, 
then all the systems in the chain (X → E and E → Y) will need to be custom and have the same category. 
If no system is found with the specific category, the request will return a 400 status code. allowFallback=true 
specifies that the service is allowed to fall back to a general system when a custom system doesn't exist.

properties.name: grade
properties.doc: Defines complexity of LLM prompts to provide high accuracy translation.

properties.name: tone
properties.doc: Desired tone of target translation.

properties.name: gender
properties.doc: Desired gender of target translation.

properties.name: adaptiveDatasetId
properties.doc: Reference dataset ID having sentence pair to generate adaptive customized translation.

properties.name: referenceTextPairs
properties.doc: Reference sentence pairs to generate adaptive results.

properties.name: source
properties.doc: Source reference sentence.

properties.name: target
properties.doc: Target reference sentence.

properties.name: detectedLanguage
properties.doc: The detectedLanguage property is only present in the result object when language auto-detection is requested.

type.name: DetectedLanguage
type.doc: An object describing the detected language.

properties.name: language
properties.doc: A string representing the code of the detected language.

properties.name: score
properties.doc:
A float value indicating the confidence in the result.
The score is between zero and one and a low score indicates a low confidence.

properties.name: translations
properties.doc:
An array of translation results. The size of the array matches the number of target 
languages specified through the to query parameter.

properties.name: language
properties.doc: A string representing the language code of the target language.

properties.name: sourceCharacters
properties.doc: An interger indicating the number of characters in the source text string

properties.name: instructionTokens
properties.doc: An interger indicating the number of tokens used in generating the translated text

properties.name: sourceTokens
properties.doc: An interger indicating the number of tokens used in the source sentence

properties.name: responseTokens
properties.doc: An interger indicating the number of tokens used in the translation response

properties.name: targetTokens
properties.doc: An interger indicating the number of tokens used in the target sentence

properties.name: text
properties.doc: A string giving the translated text.

models.name: InputTextItem
models.doc: Element containing the text for translation.

properties.name: text
properties.doc: Text to translate.

properties.name: text
properties.doc: A string which is the result of converting the input string to the output script.

properties.name: script
properties.doc: A string specifying the script used in the output.

clients.name: TextTranslationClient
clients.doc:
Text translation is a cloud-based REST API feature of the Translator service that uses neural
machine translation technology to enable quick and accurate source-to-target text translation
in real time across all supported languages.

The following methods are supported by the Text Translation feature:

Languages. Returns a list of languages supported by Translate, Transliterate, and Dictionary Lookup operations.

Translate. Renders single source-language text to multiple target-language texts with a single request.

Transliterate. Converts characters or letters of a source language to the corresponding characters or letters of a target language.

Detect. Returns the source code language code and a boolean variable denoting whether the detected language is supported for text translation and transliteration.

methods.name: getSupportedLanguages
methods.doc: Gets the set of languages currently supported by other operations of the Translator.
methods.summary: Gets the set of languages currently supported by other operations of the Translator.

operation.name: getSupportedLanguages
operation.summary: Gets the set of languages currently supported by other operations of the Translator.
operation.doc: Gets the set of languages currently supported by other operations of the Translator.

parameters.name: clientTraceId
parameters.doc: A client-generated GUID to uniquely identify the request.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.doc:
A comma-separated list of names defining the group of languages to return.
Allowed group names are: `translation`, `transliteration` and `dictionary`.
If no scope is given, then all groups are returned, which is equivalent to passing 
`scope=translation,transliteration,dictionary`. To decide which set of supported languages 
is appropriate for your scenario, see the description of the [response object](#response-body).

parameters.name: acceptLanguage
parameters.doc:
The language to use for user interface strings. Some of the fields in the response are names of languages or 
names of regions. Use this parameter to define the language in which these names are returned. 
The language is specified by providing a well-formed BCP 47 language tag. For instance, use the value `fr` 
to request names in French or use the value `zh-Hant` to request names in Chinese Traditional.
Names are provided in the English language when a target language is not specified or when localization 
is not available.

parameters.name: ifNoneMatch
parameters.doc:
Passing the value of the ETag response header in an If-None-Match field will allow the service to optimize the response. 
If the resource has not been modified, the service will return status code 304 and an empty response body.

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.doc: Mandatory API version parameter

headers.name: requestId
headers.doc: Value generated by the service to identify the request. It is used for troubleshooting purposes.

headers.name: etag
headers.doc:
Current value of the entity tag for the requested groups of supported languages. 
To make subsequent requests more efficient, the client may send the `ETag` value in an 
`If-None-Match` header field.

examples.description: Gets the set of languages currently supported by other operations of the Translator.

The language is specified by providing a well-formed BCP 47 language tag. For instance, use the value `fr`

Names are provided in the English language when a target language is not specified or when localization

parameters.name: clientTraceId
parameters.doc: A client-generated GUID to uniquely identify the request.

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.doc: Mandatory API version parameter

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.doc: Body parameter's content type. Known values are application/json

parameters.name: body
parameters.doc: Defines the content of the request

headers.name: requestId
headers.doc: Value generated by the service to identify the request. It is used for troubleshooting purposes.

headers.name: mtSystem
headers.doc:
Specifies the system type that was used for translation for each 'to' language requested for translation. 
The value is a comma-separated list of strings. Each string indicates a type:

* Custom - Request includes a custom system and at least one custom system was used during translation.
* Team - All other requests

headers.name: meteredUsage
headers.doc:
Specifies consumption (the number of characters for which the user will be charged) for the translation 
job request. For example, if the word "Hello" is translated from English (en) to French (fr), 
this field will return the value '5'.

parameters.name: clientTraceId
parameters.doc: A client-generated GUID to uniquely identify the request.

parameters.name: body
parameters.doc: Defines the content of the request

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.doc: Body parameter's content type. Known values are application/json

parameters.name: clientTraceId
parameters.doc: A client-generated GUID to uniquely identify the request.

parameters.name: language
parameters.doc:
Specifies the language of the text to convert from one script to another. 
Possible languages are listed in the transliteration scope obtained by querying the service 
for its supported languages.

parameters.name: fromScript
parameters.doc:
Specifies the script used by the input text. Look up supported languages using the transliteration scope,
to find input scripts available for the selected language.

parameters.name: toScript
parameters.doc:
Specifies the output script. Look up supported languages using the transliteration scope, to find output 
scripts available for the selected combination of input language and input script.
